newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal unemployment falling steadily - ministry.
newsitem.headline: Portugal unemployment falling steadily - ministry.

text.p: A sharp fall in Portuguese unemployment in July was part of a lower overall trend and was not due to a seasonal boost from the tourism industry, the Employment Ministry said on Wednesday.

The Institute for Employment and Professional Training (IEFP) said the number of registered unemployed had fallen a year-on-year 6.8 percent in July to 428,948. The number was down 1.4 percent from the previous month.

"Since the beginning of the year there have been successive falls in unemployment at the end of each month. This implies that this month's fall is not the result of seasonal factors but is confirmation of the steadily lower trend," the ministry said in a statement.

The IEFP, which does not express unemployment figures as a percentage of the workforce, said unemployment in the southern Algarve tourism region had fallen more steeply than in other areas. -- Lisbon editorial +(351-1) 3538254
